newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - June 11.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - June 11.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

The Reserve Bank of Australia's announcement on Tuesday afternoon that the prime asset requirement (PAR) for banks to hold liquid high quality securities would be cut to three percent from six percent was seen by some freeing up A$10-12 billion of funds for the banks to lend elsewhere and possibly raising the chances of buy-backs.
* Coal and Allied Industries Ltd A$9.25 (-0.15)

Workers at Coal and Allied Industries Ltd's Hunter Valley Number One thermal coal mine went on strike at midnight on Wednesday over stalled enterprise bargaining negotiations, Coal and Allied said. The company, which is 71 percent owned by Rio Tinto Ltd, said the strike at the mine in the state of New South Wales would cost A$1 million a day in lost revenue.

Australian shipping group Holyman Ltd said it agreed in principle with Brierley Investments Ltd to buy the Australian shipping businesses of Union Shipping Group for A$58.3 million. Holyman also said it expected to earn between A$14 million and A$16 million after tax in calendar 1996.

Formulab Neuronetics Corp Ltd said on Tuesday it had successfully won approval to list on the NASDAQ Small Cap Market. Formulab executive director Ken King said the company's American Depositary Receipts would be traded under the registration FNCLY from June 16.
